trope	description	trope_url
Abandoned Area	A place (or index) with nobody in it.	http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AbandonedArea
Abandoned Catchphrase	A character has a catchphrase early on, only for it to fall out of favor.	http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AbandonedCatchphrase
Abandoned Hospital	Abandoned hospitals are spooky.	http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AbandonedHospital
Abandoned Hospital Awakening	When a character wakes up in deserted medical facility, typically without knowing why.	http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AbandonedHospitalAwakening
Abandoned Info Page	Material that should get the audience up to speed is severely outdated.	http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AbandonedInfoPage
Abandoned Laboratory	Abandoned science laboratories are spooky, usually because there's something dangerous present.	http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AbandonedLaboratory

Abandoned War Child	Child left neglected during the war.	http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AbandonedWarChild
Abandoned Warehouse	Big empty warehouses are good places for plot events to happen.	http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AbandonedWarehouse

Snake Pit	Snakes in a hole.	http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SnakePit
Snakes Are Sexy	Snakes, and to an extension reptiles in general, are seen as sexy and useable for fanservice.	http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SnakesAreSexy
Snakes Are Sinister	Snakes are evil.	http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SnakesAreSinister

Snap To The Side	Instead of turning around, characters move their eyeballs to the side to look behind themselves.	http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SnapToTheSide
Snark Bait	A work that people watch/read/consume in order to make fun of it.	http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SnarkBait

So Beautiful Its A Curse	A character's beauty is a source of problems.	http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SoBeautifulItsACurse
